title: Readers: What’s your favorite spot for apple picking?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Boston.com seeks readers' input to update their guide to Massachusetts' best apple orchards for 2025.
Hollis Hills Farms and Red Apple Farm recently recognized by USA Today as top U.S. apple orchards.
In 2023, Honey Pot Hill Orchards was voted the favorite by Boston.com readers; new voting is underway.

title: Photos: Highlights from Day 2 at Seisiún Irish music festival in Boston
author: Boston.com
bullets: The Seisiún Irish music festival continued on a rainy Day 2 at Suffolk Downs with undeterred crowds and performances.
Headliners like The Pogues, The Waterboys, and Glen Hansard performed amid the wet weather at the Boston venue.
Festivalgoers wore ponchos to stay dry while enjoying the diverse Irish music acts and vibrant sunset scenes.

title: Mike Vrabel on Drake Maye, Will Campbell, and Bill Belichick’s comments about banning Patriots scouts
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Mike Vrabel acknowledged the lack of "complementary football" in the Patriots' season-opening 20-13 loss against the Raiders.
Vrabel criticized quarterback Drake Maye's heavy passing game, advocating for a more balanced offensive approach with improved rushing.
Patriots head coach addressed Belichick's barring of scouts and assessed rookie tackle Will Campbell's steady debut performance.

title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A judge ordered the reinstatement of fired Cannabis Control Commission Chair Shannon O'Brien; the state has filed an appeal.
Massachusetts Treasurer Deborah Goldberg alleged Shannon O'Brien committed misconduct, leading to her firing in September 2024.
Suffolk Superior Court Judge Robert Gordon criticized Goldberg's decision, calling it unfounded; O'Brien's term expires August 2027.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Police found a 38-year-old woman dead on Newhall Street in Lynn early Sunday, per Essex County DA.
A 30-year-old Lynn man was arrested and charged with murder, according to District Attorney Paul Tucker.
The suspect is set to be arraigned Monday in Lynn District Court; names remain undisclosed.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers expressed contentment with the Raiders despite his recent request to be traded being denied.
Meyers is in the final year of his contract and is seeking a new deal from the Las Vegas Raiders.
Meyers returned to Gillette Stadium, catching eight passes for 97 yards in Raiders' 20-13 win over Patriots.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A radar-confirmed tornado touched down near Worcester, Massachusetts, during Saturday's storm, according to the National Weather Service.
The tornado, confirmed in Holden, caused damage but the full extent will be assessed after a NWS survey on Monday.
Severe thunderstorms impacted much of the East Coast, with power outages and fallen trees reported in Paxton and Holyoke.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' new head coach Mike Vrabel aimed to rejuvenate the team with offseason signings, including Stefon Diggs and Milton Williams.
Quarterback Drake Maye struggled in the second half, contributing to a 20-13 season-opening loss against the Raiders.
Despite defensive improvements by Harold Landry, Patriots allowed Raiders QB Geno Smith to pass for 362 yards and 9 explosive plays.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie left tackle Will Campbell's NFL debut saw strong early performance but late-game struggles led to Patriots' 20-13 loss.
Campbell's late errors included two sacks allowed and false start penalties, impacting the Patriots' comeback attempt.
Despite struggles, Campbell received praise from Raiders’ Maxx Crosby, noting the tackle's future potential.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer was placed on leave after a video showed him 'suddenly incapacitated' during a traffic stop.
The officer, whose name is withheld, reportedly experienced a medical episode while on duty, sparking an investigation.
Lynn police are reviewing body camera footage and consulting medical professionals to determine the incident's cause.
